thread.title: Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions Connects Florida Hospital Center Ice
thread.title_full: Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions Connects Florida Hospital Center Ice

author: admin
title: Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions Connects Florida Hospital Center Ice
text:
Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions 
TAMPA, Fla., Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions announced today that it will provide state-of-the art Internet, voice and video services to the new Florida Hospital Center Ice facility, currently under construction in Wesley Chapel, Florida. 
Bright House Networks will connect the new building with its Managed WiFi, Dedicated Internet Access (DIA), Hosted Voice, and High Definition Video services. The company will also provide Florida Hospital Center Ice with Managed Network and Managed Security. Florida Hospital Center Ice, which broke ground in February, is Florida's only four-rink center, featuring an Olympic size rink as well as three NHL-sized rinks - one that can be converted to a multi-sport pad for basketball, volleyball, and box lacrosse, and one mini rink. The facility will host leagues and summer camps, and also include an on-site sports medicine specialist, full restaurant, pro shop, and off-ice training facilities. The facility will also offer off-ice sports conditioning and performance improvement programs. 
"Construction on Florida Hospital Center Ice is in full gear, and we are pleased to partner with Bright House Networks to bring our visitors the best communications services available," said Gordie Zimmermann, managing partner of Z Mitch, LLC, development group of Florida Hospital Center Ice. "Our facility will be one of the premiere locations in Florida for activities on and off the ice, and we are confident that Bright House Networks services will allow our families, teams, members and visitors to stay connected and enjoy an incomparable experience at Florida Hospital Center Ice." 
"From ice hockey to curling and indoor sports like basketball, volleyball and box lacrosse, Florida Hospital Center Ice will be a great place for people of all ages to stay active and have fun," said Craig Cowden, chief network officer and senior vice president of Enterprise Solutions, Bright House Networks. "We are pleased to partner with them to offer our industry-leading video, voice and Internet solutions, as well as our managed services so that their visitors can stay connected 24/7/365 and their staff stay focused on business-critical initiatives." 
Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions offers a comprehensive portfolio of video, voice, data, cloud, and managed services that can be customized to meet the communications needs of any organization. The company offers scalable solutions for clients to expand their level of service as needed, all delivered over its extensive and secure facilities-based IP core fiber network, which it owns and operates for best in class performance and reliability. The company also offers local 24x7x365 support, and dedicated local sales executives and solutions engineers. 
For more information about all the products and services provided by Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions, visit www.brighthouse.com/enterprise . 
For more information about Florida Hospital Center Ice (FHCI), visit www.floridahospitalcenterice.com . For more information about Z Mitch, LLC (owner developer of FHCI), visit www.zmitch.com . 
About Bright House Networks Bright House Networks is the sixth largest owner and operator of cable systems in the U.S. and the second largest in Florida, with technologically advanced systems located in five states including Florida, Alabama, Indiana, Michigan and California and two of the top 20 DMAs. Bright House Networks serves approximately 2.5 million customers who subscribe to one or more of its video, high-speed data, home security and automation and voice services. Bright House Networks Business Solutions offers a strong portfolio of video, voice, data, and cloud-based solutions to the small and medium business segments. In addition, Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions provides advanced, fiber-based telecommunication services to key industry verticals in the mid-market and carrier segments, including cloud-based hosted voice, managed security, and cell backhaul to wireless carriers. The company is CiscoÂ® Master Service Provider-certified under the Cisco Cloud and Managed Service Program, the first cable operator in the United States to achieve this designation. Bright House Networks also owns and operates exclusive, award-winning, local news and sports channels in its Florida markets. For more information about Bright House Networks, or our products and services, visit brighthouse.com. 
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/bright-house-networks-enterprise-solutions-connects-florida-hospital-center-ice-300136749.html 
SOURCE Bright House Networks Enterprise Solutions
